required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective and Retrospective, Non-interventional Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of Obizur in Real-life Practice
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective and Retrospective, Non-interventional Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of Obizur in Real-life Practice

collaborator.agency: Baxalta Innovations GmbH, now part of Shire

brief_summary.textblock: The study addresses the safety, utilisation and effectiveness of Obizur in the treatment of bleeding episodes in real-life clinical practice in Europe and the United States.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of AEs and SAEs including seriousness, severity and outcome
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
primary_outcome.description: AE - adverse event, SAE - serious adverse event.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of AESIs including seriousness, severity, relationship to therapy, outcome, and treatment discontinuation
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
primary_outcome.description: Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESI) are as follows: hypersensitivity reactions, thromboembolic events and dose dispensing medication errors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
primary_outcome.description: Thromboembolic events include disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC), venous thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, myocardial infarction and stroke.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of dose dispensing medication errors
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
primary_outcome.description: Dose dispensing medication erros include miscalculation of dose while prescribing (calculation of correct dose based on the participant's weight) or administration of the incorrect dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity; newly recognized anti-pFVIII inhibitor or increase in titre of anti-pFVIII inhibitors and evolution of titre over time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
secondary_outcome.description: This may include details of the Obizur treatment regimen utilized, as available

secondary_outcome.measure: Other medication administered for haemostatic control, as available
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
secondary_outcome.description: This may include additional medications, treatments and procedures (other than Obizur) undertaken to control a bleeding episode.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall effectiveness assessment for resolution of bleeding
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
secondary_outcome.description: Resolution of bleeding determined as either bleeding stopped or did not stop. If bleeding did not stop, a reason should be provided.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose per infusion administered to achieve bleeding control, death or change in haemostatic treatment other than Obizur
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding control defined as all bleeding stopped.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of infusions administered to achieve bleeding control, death or change in haemostatic treatment other than Obizur
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding control defined as all bleeding stopped.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to achieve bleeding control, death or change in haemostatic treatment other than Obizur
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first administration of Obizur up to 180 days after the last administration of Obizur.
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding control defined as all bleeding stopped.

arm_group.description: Participants previously treated with OBIZUR and continue to be treated with OBIZUR during the study.

intervention.description: Treating physician will determine treatment regimen and frequency of laboratory and clinical assessments according to routine clinical practice.

study_pop.textblock: A participant with acquired hemophilia (AH) must be prescribed Obizur for the treatment of a bleeding episode by a physician, independent of and prior to the decision to enrol the participant in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult participant (or legal representative) is willing to provide informed consent
- Participant is being treated or was treated (treatment initiation within 30 days) with Obizur in routine clinical practice
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant has known anaphylactic reactions to the active substance, hamster protein or to any of the following excipients: Polysorbate 80; sodium chloride; calcium chloride dihydrate; sucrose; Tris Base; Tris HCl; Tri-sodium citrate dihydrate; sterilized water for injections
- Participant has participated in a clinical study involving a medicinal product or device within 30 days prior to enrollment or is scheduled to participate in another clinical study involving a medicinal product or device at study entry

facility.name: Azienda Ospedaliera Nazionale Santi Antonio e Biagio e Cesare Arrigo
Azienda Ospedaliero Universitaria Policlinico Paolo Giaccone
Umberto I Pol. di Roma-Università di Roma La Sapienza

patient_data.ipd_description: Shire provides access to the de-identified individual participant data for eligible studies to aid qualified researchers in addressing legitimate scientific objectives. These IPDs will be provided following approval of a data sharing request, and under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: IPD from eligible studies will be shared with qualified researchers according to the criteria and process described in the Data Sharing section of the www.shiretrials.com website. For approved requests, the researchers will be provided access to anonymized data (to respect patient privacy in line with applicable laws and regulations) and with information necessary to address the research objectives under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
